results.headline: Crop-Top Tax Offers Bit of Relief to Struggling Brazil Retailers
results.summary: A long-awaited import tax on purchases up to $50 will offer short-term relief to Brazil’s battered retailers as they stumble over longer-term hurdles.

results.headline: Ukraine Struggles to Court Global South Before Swiss Summit
results.summary: Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva stopped off in Switzerland on Thursday. He won’t be returning for a summit on Ukraine 48 hours later.

results.headline: India, Saudi Arabia to Send Senior Envoys to Ukraine Summit
results.summary: The Swiss government confirmed that China won’t send a diplomat to a two-day summit on Ukraine, while India and Saudia Arabia will send senior officials to the June 15-16 meeting.

results.headline: Gregorio Perez Companc, One of Argentina’s Richest, Dies at 89
results.summary: Gregorio Perez Companc, who helped transform the face of Argentina’s corporate world with investments from telecommunications to farming and oil, which made him a billionaire, has died. He was 89.

results.authors: By Davison Santana and Vinicius Andrade
results.headline: ‘It’s Untradeable’: Wild Swings Roil Brazil Swap Rates Market
results.summary: Brazil should be a paradise for investors betting on lower swap rates. With stunningly high real rates and inflation on the decline, a trade that benefits from falling interest rates is a no-brainer.

results.authors: By Daryna Krasnolutska and Alessandro Speciale
results.headline: Saudis Expected to Attend Ukraine Summit After Zelenskiy’s Visit
results.summary: Officials from several countries expect Saudi Arabia to attend a summit in Switzerland on the war in Ukraine after a surprise visit by President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to the kingdom earlier this week.

results.headline: Brazil’s Economic Activity Flatlines
results.summary: Brazil’s economic activity stalled in April according to a report that comes days before central bankers are seen halting their almost yearlong cycle of interest rate cuts.

results.headline: PGIM Sticks With Bearish Treasury Call on Bet Fed May Still Hike
results.summary: While bond traders have rekindled bets for interest-rate cuts by the Federal Reserve, PGIM Fixed Income says the central bank may actually lean back toward a hike.

results.headline: G-7 to Step Up Action on Russia Fleet, Energy, Metals
results.summary: Group of Seven leaders meeting in Italy this week will pledge to tighten enforcement of their price cap on Russian oil, choke the Kremlin’s future energy projects and reduce Moscow’s revenues from metals, according to a statement seen by Bloomberg.

results.authors: By Manuela Tobias and Kevin Simauchi
results.headline: Milei IMF Deal Talks: Legislative Wins Give Argentina Momentum
results.summary: President Javier Milei will walk into a meeting with the head of the International Monetary Fund on Friday emboldened by the most successful series of wins since the libertarian economist took power in Argentina six months ago.
